intro: Galium grayanum subsp. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, ascending stems covered with small, opposite leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small, white or pale green, and arranged in cymes, contributing to its ornamental value. It is characterized by its reduced pubescence, which gives it the subspecies name "glabrescens."
